entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as the one who left a daunting complex mission for Harry. He is also described as someone Harry idolized and had grief for since his death.

entities.name: horcruxes
entities.description: Horcruxes are mentioned as something Dumbledore had left Harry to deal with.

entities.name: muriel
entities.description: Muriel is mentioned as someone who accused Harry of things at the wedding.

entities.name: godric's hollow
entities.description: Godric's Hollow is mentioned as a place where Dumbledore had graves that he never mentioned.

entities.name: krebacher
entities.description: Kreacher is mentioned in the title of the chapter but not in the text itself. However, it can be inferred from the context that Kreacher's Tale is a story about Kreacher.

entities.name: dudley
entities.description: Dudley is mentioned as someone Harry compares Dumbledore to.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character and narrator of the story.

relationships.description: Dumbledore assigned Harry to deal with Horcruxes.
Harry was accused of things by Muriel at the wedding.
Dumbledore had graves in Godric's Hollow that he never mentioned to Harry.
Harry had grief for Dumbledore since his death.
Harry resented Dumbledore for not explaining things to him.
Harry questioned whether Dumbledore cared about him at all.
